article:
Events and trends
* 763 BCâJune 15âA solar eclipse at this date (in month Sivan) is used to fix
  the chronology of the Ancient Near East. However, it requires Nisan 1 to fall
  on March 20, 763 BC, which was 8 to 9 days before the vernal equinox (March
  28/29 at that time) and Babylonians never started their calendar year before
  the spring equinox.


Significant people
* Death of Argishtis I of Urartu
* Death of Amaziah of Judah
* Death of Archilaus, king of Sparta
* Death of Marduk-apla-usur and Eriba-Marduk, kings of Babylon
* Death of Rivallo (legendary king of the Britons)
* Death of Alara of Nubia, King of Kuch c. 765 BC
